Question: Following the campaign, this person remained in the public debate with the ____ Radio Commentary series.
Hints: At the time of his death, this person was the longest-lived president in U.S.
On July 13, 1985, this person underwent surgery at Bethesda Naval Hospital to remove cancerous polyps from his colon.
This person had one sibling, his older brother, Neil (1908–1996), who became an advertising executive.
